other_tests.findings: Diffuse severe steatosis with microvesicular pattern predominantly in the centrilobular regions and macrovesicular pattern in the periportal areas. No evidence of hepatitis, hepatocellular necrosis, fibrosis, or ductular reaction.
Prominent and well-defined abnormal lipid peaks at 1.4 and 0.9 ppm; relatively normal ratios of N-acetylaspartate to creatine and choline to creatine.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The abnormal lipid peaks were no longer seen on magnetic resonance spectroscopy performed when the patient was 15 months of age.
